questions.skill: Draw conclusions from sample data about a population
questions.question: A researcher surveys 500 randomly selected voters in a city and finds that 280 support a new policy. Which of the following is the best estimate of the percentage of all voters in the city who support the policy?
questions.explanation: The sample proportion is 280/500 = 0.56 = 56%. Since the sample is random, this proportion is the best estimate of the population proportion. The key is recognizing that random sampling allows inference to the population.
